website_summaries.verdict: A versatile and compact tool designed to self-adjust so it can automatically fit a wide variety of nuts and bolts.
pros: This chromium-vanadium steel model features 54 spring-actuated steel rods that instantly conform to the shape of the fastener
The wrench comes with an adapter so it can be easily attached to your electric drill
A limited one-year warranty is also included
cons: This item isn't recommended for heavy-duty use, as it may sustain damaged if too much force is applied

customer_reviews.title: Took a gamble, and lost (Company bribes to take negative reviews down)
customer_reviews.text: It's one of those things you really hope works for the sake of convenience, but just doesn't. Mine broke literally within seconds. Tried to center on a 1/4" bolt and kept slipping off. Tried on a 1/2" and the prongs wouldn't come back up. Disappointing experience but lesson learned. Just stick with seperate sockets with the right sizing. UPDATE: Company was apologetic and offered a full refund (if I took my review down). While the refund is appreciated, I feel like they should focus more on putting out a quality product. Reviews are what we rely on here and people deserve to know what they're spending their money on.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Company Pride
customer_reviews.text: Have tried it for three separate applications that should have been simple. Didn’t do the job. Update: The company became aware of my review, and contacted me very humbly. Their representative, Nicki Li was apologetic, and insisted that I allow her to send a replacement. I must say I am impressed by the companies goal toward customer satisfaction, and it’s representative Ms. Li. The replacement tool performs much better. I am glad I gave it, as well as the company a second chance. I can now add my complete recommendation to this company.
customer_reviews.author: Td Evans

customer_reviews.title: compatible with leatherman bit extender
customer_reviews.text: it's compatible with leatherman bit extender :) now i have all in one tool
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Item does not work. Gets jammed up pretty bad. Does not grip at all. I wasted my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: LAWSONRANGER

customer_reviews.title: Strips anything with more than 15lbs
customer_reviews.text: This thing can’t handle bolts over 15lbs of torque. Was hoping to use this to alleviate socket changes, all it did was end up in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: This might be a great idea but it did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: This might be a great idea but it did not work for me. I will recommended it only for a car mechanic or someone who work with big bolts/nuts as you must have huge space around the bolt head or otherwise this socket just will not fit. I was about to give it only 3 stars but because I did not use it I gave 4 for the idea only. Note: it looks very small in the pictures but it’s very wide.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Not strong, not working, broken in first use
customer_reviews.text: Tried to open a small screw, could not open, middle metal pieces broke, chips came out. It’s a nice concept but seems to be defective, not working
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: repackaged again
customer_reviews.text: The shipment arrived and when opening the cover of the piece shows the presence of scratches and blows on the whole body of the piece from the outside and it seems to me that it is used and repackaged again
customer_reviews.author: abdullah alotebi

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: I like the versatility and the time it saves from having to switch sockets. The grip is good. The one I bought is 1/4” drive. It works in my impact wrench with the adapter. This is a great tool to have in your toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: MGab

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: The socket worked great for about 10 minutes until a 1/4" square headed bolt caused the pins to seize up and no longer work. Now it's just a paper weight
customer_reviews.author: Matt Giger

customer_reviews.title: Crap!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! Does NOT work!! Put it on the bolt/nut, and it will just start to bend. Does not stay flush on the bolt/nut. Crap product!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to use around the house if you are to lazy to find the actual socket that fits on the bolt you are tightening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: does what it says. Its great for around the house and light duty.. i would be a little hesitant to use this full time in a shop or something. i just feel like it would break. but for the weekend warrior like myself this is a god sent. feels well made and i expect it to last a good while
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Just my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I thought this will be helpful and replace some other sockets that I have to carry. The second the I used it it jammed, the nut was a pain to remove and the socket fell apart. Maybe I just a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great and easy to use. Used it the first day on building a shed. I could not find my other drill parts for the bolts. Put this bad boy on and did not have to look for the missing parts. Will buy another and keep it in the car and one in the tool bag
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!! Broke with 1st use.
customer_reviews.text: Product broke on the first attempt to remove a screw. This ‘tool’ would not perform a simple extraction from a piece of wood furniture (no wood glue was used). This product broke instantly and is no longer useable. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: B. G.

customer_reviews.title: broke on 2nd use/new update
customer_reviews.text: broke on the second time that I used it. the inside steel piece broke off. not a good design, the inner front piece was about 1/4 inch size, but the back of that piece is like 1/16 piece which easily broke off. the space is there, they should make the center piece same size on the front all the way to the back. very disappointed, definitely not worth the money, delayed my project. updated 2018-08-06 -- customer service contacted me and able to send a replacement part fast. maybe the first one is defected. will give it another try on my next project.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Li

customer_reviews.title: Completely Useless
customer_reviews.text: I have had this socket for a year now and tried to use it in a variety of situations. I have found it to be completely useless. It sounded like a great idea but is very shallow, does not create a tight fit, and breaks easily.
customer_reviews.author: J. Faircloth

customer_reviews.title: Good for one or two uses
customer_reviews.text: Loved it for the few times that it came in handy and worked. Was good for taking out square lags but not for any that were deep or but and bolt but did come in handy a few times until yesterday when I was locked in a garage taking bolts out and all of the pins in it got messed up and I was stuck in the garage and had to do the rest but hand . If it stayed together it would be a pretty good product for sure but not happy would be better off with a universal socket set and then tried to find out about the warranty and no way to contact definitively not impressed
customer_reviews.author: ted contois

customer_reviews.title: Came damaged
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 for a gift for Christmas and not just one but TWO of them came broken and now I can’t gift them..... UPDATE: got a replacement for new ones and THIS TIME A LOT WORSE. IT CAME OUT OF THE PACKAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work, tried using on a small project and unfortunately it was over the return period. It would not secure bolt and it just keep skidding and not tightening.
customer_reviews.author: Truelady

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Not worth a dam. First time trying to use it the dam thing broke 0 stars if I could
customer_reviews.author: ramon corral

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Handy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This universal socket is awesome. Instead of having to go through my whole set to find the right one, I was able to seat this perfectly on the screw and extract it. What a time saver and it worked really well!
customer_reviews.author: JoTo

customer_reviews.title: It works on a variety of sizes and even worn ...
customer_reviews.text: It works on a variety of sizes and even worn heads. Be careful not to push to firmly because the rods really do grasp the heads and the screw/bolt become tougher to remove from the socket the further the head is inserted. A handy addition to my toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: DJ8725

customer_reviews.title: CANT HANDLE BIKE NUTS.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to deal with standard 15mm nuts on my road bike but these sockets are not meant to be used to apply any kind of torque on a nut specially the kind needed to properly tighten the rear and front wheel nuts. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy
customer_reviews.text: Broke after the first uses. The pins a jamed inside
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this product. I had high hopes this would convert to not lugging around my socket set, but the universal socket does not work near as well as I thought given the fairly high review score it’s received. It seems as though the depth would work for most nut sizes but in reality the pin depth is very shallow considering the size of the universal socket. Durability seemed fine however.
customer_reviews.author: sarrenity66

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: Worst tool ever. If your screws happened to be stuck this isn’t the righ tool to use. It will not get a grip of it and turn. You better off using the right size socket for whatever you’re working on.
customer_reviews.author: Christin cosuineau

customer_reviews.title: Moderately functional for *most* situations
customer_reviews.text: While the idea behind the concept of a universal socket seems ingenious, it does have a few drawbacks. It works fairly on most standard nuts, but the pins that latch on to the sides of the nut often slip without properly getting a good grip on the nut's surface when dealing with metric or odd-sized nuts. For the price, it's a decent enough tool, and it works in a pinch when loosening or tightening an unexposed nut - but I've learned in the end that nothing replaces a decent set of mechanic wrenches and sockets to get the job done right and without scratching the surface coating of nuts that are going to be exposed.
customer_reviews.author: Amygdala6

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have actually been wanting to buy one of these for years. It was one of those items I didn't really need because I have a full set of sockets. But there is something being said for having a single socket in your pocket that can be used on any bolt. I used this yesterday while fixing some doors on my shed. I was able to go from bold to bolt and loosen and tighten them without any issue. It also seems like it's well made. Time will tell if it falls apart, but it feels solid and I think it's sturdy enough to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: This works
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool ... easily fit onto partially stripped bolt heads and backed 'em right out. For the price, a must have for your toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: KW Kinne

customer_reviews.title: A good concept and works well where it can
customer_reviews.text: A good concept and works well where it can. But doesn't work in all situations. For example; If there is less space around the bolt which you want to take out, the huge face of this socket won't go in to take the bolt out. In my case, 7 out of 10 places did not work due to the space issue. So, I had to get the individual sockets for that size. It is a good tool to have it around if you understand the limitations. I'll keep it in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: a3d

customer_reviews.title: saved my bacon
customer_reviews.text: so glad i had this in my toolbox. i stripped a few screws and worked perfectly although not what it was intended for. also shower spout broke off and used this tool to unscrew the broken piece in the wall, saved my bacon. has all kind of uses when in a pinch and helped with impossible jobs that i would have to wait next day trip to home depot for correct tool
customer_reviews.author: SEAN CHITTICK

customer_reviews.title: It's good quality, though I've not put a ton of ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this several times for those pesky bolts where neither a metric or standard socket seems to fit right. It's good quality, though I've not put a ton of torque on it for anything. Pretty neat concept, I'd buy another one if mine breaks.
customer_reviews.author: ClintH

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a very useful tool.
customer_reviews.text: This universal socket is very useful for low to mid-torque jobs. Quite handy in that you don’t have to switch sockets, and the applications using small eye fasteners and the like. For those applications using high-torque and/or torque wrench, use an exact size socket.
customer_reviews.author: Steve O

customer_reviews.title: Don't work
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me I use it 3 times and the third one it damage the inside pins and now is unusable.
customer_reviews.author: AlexUnboxingChannel

customer_reviews.title: Definitely helps you save time energy and effort.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve seen this product advertised on Facebook as well as on TV and wondered if it really worked or if it was a piece of junk. Well, it really does work and it’s amazing. This is not a product that you have to have but it’s a product that makes life a lot easier. When installing and I hook you can always use a screwdriver and twist and twist and twist to tighten it or you can pop this in your drill and have that installed in a second. Definitely helps you save time energy and effort.
customer_reviews.author: April Olive

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy duty use
customer_reviews.text: The pins popped out the very first time I used it, however I was trying to remove a lug nut. There's no mention of intended limitations or maximum torque spec. This would be fine for extremely light duty use, however the fact there's plenty of promotional images on the listing showing the socket attached to power tools suggests otherwise. It's also worth noting the pins were NOT round, they were hexagonal shaped.
customer_reviews.author: AudioGuy

customer_reviews.title: This snapped on first use and Kusonkey doesn't respond to customer support requests
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and was excited to give it a try on a TV wall mount installation. The holes were all pre-drilled so the tension wasn't extraordinarily high, but there's some sort of a spring-loaded mechanism inside the socket that snapped on the sixth or seventh turn. After that, it no longer holds its shape inside the socket and therefore is too loose to be of any use. If you like throwing away your money, please buy this. Otherwise, DO NOT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.author: Phaitour

customer_reviews.title: This product is very sturdy works very well
customer_reviews.text: This product is very sturdy works very well. I have used too many times already I haven't had any damages to it keeps working and working good product
customer_reviews.author: Ron W

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had this socket for quite a few months and it is a little gimmicky but it is useful for when you just can’t get that exact size socket and you get frustrated and just use this. Or I’ve also used it when I don’t want to carry a whole bunch of different size sockets with me when I’m doing something small. It’s worked and held up. I don’t apply extreme torque on it so I can’t attest how well it would hold up under heavy load but it works for what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: rachel tetreault

customer_reviews.title: Works ok but very shallow for such a huge shocket.
customer_reviews.text: NOT FOR USE AS AN IMPACT SOCKET! But otherwise works great on a variety of sizes, only drawback is it's very shallow but that hasn't stopped it from working on shorter nuts or bolts. The incuded drive shaft would not keep it attached and constantly detaches under use. Had to be duct taped on to keep from losing it!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lovett

customer_reviews.title: Great, for the right task
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad tool to have. You just need to use it for the right applications. If you have something like self tapping lags, then no good for that, as the spring loaded device more fights you that anything. However, if you have a whole bunch of bolts, nuts, of various sizes, you can fly through those. It handed those with no issue and was in fact great and saved a lot of time. All in all, it's great if you use it for the right task.
customer_reviews.author: james m bowers

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It will save you time looking for the right socket. It is under $8 and it has already saved me more than that in time alone. If you are like me and don't like messing around with dozens of different tools to fix a small issue, then this is the product for you. Obviously, it may not work in every situation depending on the size of the fastener you are trying to remove or if it is in a tight spot; however, it works in enough situations where I consider this a must buy for the amateur handyman.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it but it didn't work for my situation.
customer_reviews.text: It seems sturdy and well made. It didn't work for my situation. The bolt, the rounded off nut was on. was too long so the universal ratchet head couldn't reach down to the problem. I think the ratchet would've done the job other wise. I'm looking forward to using it another time. I bought it because I had heard good things about them. It came very quickly, even arriving a day early.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Harding

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: Bought fiance for Christmas and he's actually really impressed with it so far. However, he's only tinkered around with it, tightening an untightening various bolts in his apartment so I'm still a little uncertain about long-term durability based on other reviews but fingers are definitely crossed. He's not terribly handy so I doubt it will get too much use but if it ends up breaking or whatnot, I'll try to remember to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: SuzieQ

customer_reviews.title: Not as useful as I thought.
customer_reviews.text: Regular sockets work better than this thing. It only works well for sizes that fit conveniently between the little teeth. If you have a bolt that is between one of those sizes, then this thing will just constantly slip off of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya Zubarev

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: after using this the second time the pins do not want to go back into place with the spring to be able to remove or drive in a nut. this is horrible quality and just for the second use is not something I want. I would like a request for my money back. Do not buy this tool
customer_reviews.author: Armin

customer_reviews.title: junk dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: did not work well at all ,had to push on to bolt perfectly to center it,hard to work with
customer_reviews.author: robert w.

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe it! It worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once, but when I needed it, it was a lifesaver. It saved me several trips up and down a ladder to remove old signs. I highly recommend it. As a matter of fact, the maintenance worker ordered one on the spot when I showed it to him. Like me, he had seen it before, but was leery of how well it would work. I am glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: APD

customer_reviews.title: Slips often. Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I have attempted to use this on 6 different applications and it slips every time. Not sure what the other reviews are talking about, yet my experience has not been favorable. I recommend a good socket set in lieu of this one-size approach.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One socket to do it all
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I too was a bit skeptical about this product. In the end, it was purchased to give it a try. I figured if it didn't work, I'd just return it for a refund. I'm glad to report, the product works as advertised. I've used it to remove up to 19 mm nuts with no problems. It just grips more securely the moire torque you apply.
customer_reviews.author: APC900

customer_reviews.title: Broke within first 15 seconds.
customer_reviews.text: Seems sort of generic. Broke within first few seconds of using it.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Universal Socket
customer_reviews.text: I just had to buy one of these for my workbench. I know I have had bad days where I could not find the right size wrench when I know I have several of them. Now I don't have to worry about it. I can just pick this up from my workbench and finish the job.
customer_reviews.author: Edith

customer_reviews.title: Serves some purposes
customer_reviews.text: My intention was to be able to carry this single socket and a driver rather than a whole socket set - in my boat, truck, on a service call to tenants. This will work IF you have a surface nut / bolt. If you have to reach onto a bolt at all - it does not allow the pins to retreat far enough to be effective. Good idea - needs deeper run for better "all purpose" use.
customer_reviews.author: LostCaptain

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one before but I lost it. Ordered the same new one, broke on the second nut without warning. Something happened to the quality control there. Forgot to take a picture before it sent it back
customer_reviews.author: Alex Sush

customer_reviews.title: Its amazing tho
customer_reviews.text: Cool product. But it's not like you can use it everyday for anything. I bought this out of curiousity, i dont even have tools. I dont even have a house or a car to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Works as good as they say
customer_reviews.text: I had a hex nut fastener that was all rounded with wear and I spent hours and hours trying to get that damn thing off on my golf cart. I tried all sorts of tools and muscle. The guy at L and M suggested this tool and I did not have high hopes, but I got it off right away. Everyone should have one in their tool box..
customer_reviews.author: Richar M. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have in your bag and traveling light
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of weekend work replacing/installing light fixtures, as well as dimming controls.. I'm based in NYC and want to travel light (getting to sites by bike, or motorcycle) so universal tools are critical components to my tool bag. While nuts typically can be handled with a pair of pliers.. putting this universal socket on the end of my electric driver is a godsend for speeding through work. So far, it's held up great and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: andrew72

customer_reviews.title: Not function well
customer_reviews.text: It’s not function as described. None of screws can proper work with this
customer_reviews.author: LouisChang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for jobs with varied sizing
customer_reviews.text: I’ve known these to break on big bolts but this one handles pretty well. I’ve used in on several jobs, usually larger lugs. It works about the same as a fitted socket but of course is easier when dealing with multiple sizes. Make sure it’s parallel to your lug/nut; otherwise you risk breaking pins or stripping material.
customer_reviews.author: Julien

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: likes : works fantastic on automotove or harware boltsive tried it on my rechargabe screwdriver on my car. this method works a lot faster than a ratchet wrench ! cons; may not work on wood screws {havent tried it yet on the wood screws} also if the socket is not centered on the bolt correctly it will lock on to the bolt you would have to reverse the direction to unlock the socket from the bolt !
customer_reviews.author: david buchbinder

customer_reviews.title: Universal Socket, Kusonkey
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Socket Tool Sets. High-End quality, heavy duty and reliable, made forever. I would buy it again, w/o hesitation. Works exactly like it should be and It does what it design/made for not much to say about it! Happy with this purchase! I would recommend to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Laczko Studio

customer_reviews.title: Not for bolts, but.........
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't use this for bolts or nuts BUT ever try to screw in or out hooks and eyelets? Ya there's nothing better for odd house hold hardware. This is the third one I've purchased from different places. Wish they carried the larger one on Amazon but this is a needed addition to any tool box
customer_reviews.author: Laura Howard

customer_reviews.title: Cheap tool delivered broken in package
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. CAME BROKEN, CHEAP QUALITY. TOTAL PIECE OF GARBAGE
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work. Not even a little bit.
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to screw in a stripped screw, but this didn't even try to work. Didn't grip the screw, in spite of it being within the measured guidelines. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Everything
customer_reviews.text: This universal socket is everything you'd expect and more. It's very versatile and goes with any screw or anything you would need a bit for. It's reasonably priced and worth the money. It's very durable. I have used it countless times and it still works just like new.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Convenient. Solidly made. Comes with set up for electric drill connection. They should’ve included an adapter for a hand ratchet. But I managed a work around with one of the fittings that came with my hand ratchet. Still for the price, there’s no excuse for not including one.
customer_reviews.author: W.B.

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect all in one socket
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for this very tool. I’m tired of guessing and trying various sockets when working on the car. This won’t fit every exact large bolt, but it does fit the more common ones. The packaging was perfect, it arrived on time and I expect the durability to last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Esquilin Photography

customer_reviews.title: It worked for what I needed done.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to remove a rusted 7/16 agitator bolt on my Whirlpool washing machine. My regular 7/16 socket just couldn't grab onto the bolt. First spayed bolt with WD-40 silicone lubricant and let sit. Later used this socket with some downward pressure and was able to back the bolt out. Then of course replaced the bolt with a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Bobcycle

customer_reviews.title: Review.
customer_reviews.text: Review is based on common sense. Best tool for small house hold jobs. Not to be used as a replacement for impact sockets. If you can grab it then it can be removed or used for install. I have had this for several months and have used it quite often.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is magic. Every toolbox should have it. Yes, it's enormous and won't work for everything because of it. But for most stuff, it's an invaluable secret weapon. I've used it for stripped screws and other things that aren't actually nuts. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Can't use as a deep socket
customer_reviews.text: So far seems to be holding up and doing what it's supposed to do. My only complaint is that you can't use it as a deep socket. If you could actually use it as a deep socket it would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The idea is nice but it doesn't live up to the expectation. I tried it once and it broke, had to return back. Updated: the vendor responded back and sent a replacement. I may have gotten a defective piece earlier. Replacement pieces worked really great. I don’t think it is replacement for anything but a helpful tool when you are short on specific tools. Also it is good for small jobs. All in all a nice idea and good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Azeem Faraz

customer_reviews.title: Don't use Ups for overseas shipping.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item but if you are ordering it overseas be carefull they will use Ups and the facility may loose your item. Unfortunately there is no way to track the item in customs and it will be lost. Just a fare warning to those who use Upsoverseas facilities have been know to "loose" your items in customs. I've lost 3 items that "disappeared" or don't "exist".
customer_reviews.author: Shadow Hawk Bluetear

customer_reviews.title: handy item for anyone who tightens nuts & bolts
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot - I work on guitars and amps and there are many nuts & bolts that periodically need tightening (but not over-tightening).. This will snug them up faster than anything else - most times I don't even use a wrench, just the socket itself by hand. It may seem trivial to figure out which diameter a nut or bolt needs, but multiply that by 20+ times a day and you will save time and trouble. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: kenren10

customer_reviews.title: Great for Binding Posts on Amplifiers
customer_reviews.text: I use this when installing audio equipment. Of course, I have to be very careful not to over-tighten binding posts with it, but it greatly increases the speed at which I can work while hooking speakers up to amplifiers and AV receivers. The tool seems robust and like it will last me many years.
customer_reviews.author: andy1

customer_reviews.title: Only replaces three sockets
customer_reviews.text: This is good for 1/4 inch to 3/4 inch lugs, which is a replacements for three sockets. It does not do well for the metric ones between those sizes. For $14 I could buy a whole set of sockets wrenches. Better priced at $7, not versatile enough for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool
customer_reviews.text: When you need to remove or install something that is odd shaped this is the wonder-tool. I wasn't convinced until I tried it. Now I'm afraid every time someone else tries it I won't get it back. Even bought one for my mom! Could live without it but I don't want to!
customer_reviews.author: Tracie K. Startzman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect roller skate tool!
customer_reviews.text: This tool can be attached to my screwdriver with multiple bits. It makes skate truck lock nut adjustments easy, and can also tighten the wheels. It is light enough to haul around and attached to my screwdriver I can do just the right torque. I was shopping for a socket wrench set, but this obviates that purchase for me. It sure does grab!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Derk

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement poor durability
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you guys something the advertisement for the wing nut is a complete lie i used it for a wing nut and completely demolished the plastic inner piece and the pins started falling out
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Good price but ok quailty
customer_reviews.text: First use broke some of the prongs in it. Very heavy and i wosh it was shorter to fit in toghter spaces. Expected more quailty. I had bought 2 and one of them the magnetic isnt even a magntic on the inside. Not bad on price tho and it does still work.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I didn't have the money to buy a socket set so i took a chance and bought this. Well its a good invenrion but its quality sucks I used it for 2 15mms and 1 18mm and it worked fine for the 2 15mm but when i got to the 18mm foe my strut it snapped trting to take the bolt out so it was a waste of $10 and I advise anyone to read reviews and really rhink about it before buying.
customer_reviews.author: jason mowat

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Have only had the opportunity to use it once; but it worked well! Doesn't go as deep as you'd think by looking at it. If you're like me and only need a socket bit for a job here or there, it's worth the few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Evans

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool every handyman should have in his toolbelt
customer_reviews.text: Was a little skeptical when I first saw this, but it's the real deal. Super convenient not having to change out sockets trying to guess the right size. Durable and strong. A no brainer for the handyman in your life.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Used once, one of the pins already stuck
customer_reviews.text: I used it once for an odd screw I had to mount a TV. The fit wasnt as snug as I'd like it to be, and one of the pins ended up getting jammed up. I eventually got the screw in but seemed like more trouble than it was worth.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, doesn't work as well as hoped
customer_reviews.text: It's a good concept, but it slips and gouges smaller tight bolt heads, is hard to keep it directly straight on the head when exerting higher amounts of force. It's been relegated to the drawer of other gadgets I never use.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Main

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Had a nut that was rusted out and couldn’t get off bought this item used it and get it removed with no problem. Will use it for other problems in the future. Just wish it had a deeper socket for longer bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Eaddy

customer_reviews.title: Have not fond a use case yet
customer_reviews.text: Every time I think I have found a place where I can use this it fails. Also, you are unable to tighten with a lot of torque as it strips.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Anania

customer_reviews.title: broke first use
customer_reviews.text: I own a garage door repair and install company and the first time it used this product ( old garage door with square bolts) the pins inside jammed, I unjammed them a few times before the pins just broke. this was a terrible product do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Nick Presson

customer_reviews.title: Keep it close
customer_reviews.text: I love the versatility of the product. However, I can tell the durability is not something that will hold up over time. Despite this, the value for just a few bucks is worth having it around the house for any small things that arise.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as it seems.
customer_reviews.text: It's actually more difficult to use than a regular socket. You have to keep constant pressure on it or else it keeps slipping off bolt. It was cheap, so I gave it a chance. I'm sure it'll come in useful someday. Worth the money I paid, but not very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson Lamb

customer_reviews.title: takes up no room
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because i do alot of handyman jobs and having a socket that fits many sizes and takes up almost no room is very handy. you have to be careful it is sturdy but you can warp the little metal parts.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Irish

customer_reviews.title: not all that and a bag of chips
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking I could grab all types of bolts easily. Not really. The bolt has to fit dead center of the pins of it kicks out when trying to loosen. I gave up and went and bought the right socket for my collection. I cant see trying to use this again.
customer_reviews.author: tech guy

customer_reviews.title: What a great multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to determine the durability of the multi-tool, but I have been successful in using one device to remove 8 different nut head screws and bolts that would have otherwise needed 8 different tools. Nice going...
customer_reviews.author: jnsnfl

customer_reviews.title: It worked for my application
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping I could use this tool to raise and lower my trailer stabilizer jacks. When I opened the package it looked like the pins wouldn't recess deep enough to grab the wingnut like tabs on my jacks.. Then I went out and tried it. It worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for most nuts and bolts but not ones that are close to something.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok for most nuts and bolts but not ones that are close to something like a wall or pipe due to the clearance.
customer_reviews.author: Ari312

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but it's pretty useless.
customer_reviews.text: This just does not replace a real socket, it's difficult to get onto a nut and wants to self-eject if you relax the downward pressure. Used it once.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chesher

customer_reviews.title: all looks really good
customer_reviews.text: so in all honesty i haven't used this item 1 time however feeling in my hand looking it over and what not it seems to be of high quality and durability glad to have it in my arsenal
customer_reviews.author: robert w johnston

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Dad who has macular degeneration and can’t see well. He just loves it because he does not get frustrated trying to line everything up. It allows him to work on things he otherwise could not! I will be buying one for us as well.
customer_reviews.author: karen

product_meta.title: KUSONKEY Professional 7mm-19mm Universal Socket Tool Sets with Power Drill Adapter Christmas Gift for Men, DIY Handyman, Father/Dad, Husband, Boyfriend, Him, Women
feature_bullets: SPECIAL DESIGN - Unique design of this universal socket can automatically adjust to any size or shape, suitable for standard 1/4 to 3/4 inches and metric 7mm to 19mm screws, nuts, and blots, meeting all your needs. Compact and portable is easy for you to carry anywhere you want.

UNIVERSAL FIT - This universal socket wrench can be adjusted immediately to grasp most metric, wing nuts, broken nuts, stripped nuts, eye bolts, square nuts, hexes, etc. Equipped with power drill adapter, it is easy connect with most electric drills, electric screwdrivers and manual ratchet wrenches.

DURABLE MATERIAL - This universal socket adapter used durable chrome vanadium steel material, with 54 super strong steel rods that are individually spring actuated allowing the socket to automatically conform to any shape instantly, move to different types of fasteners without every changing sockets.

WIDE APPLICATION - This universal socket grip can be used in automobile industry, home maintenance, manufacturing, construction and other industries, also favored by home decoration DIY design enthusiasts. A perfect gift for Christmas, Birthdays and other Holidays for any handyman, dad, boyfriend, brother, men, or women.

QUALITY GUARANTEE - If for any reason you are unsatisfied with it, please feel free to contact us, we will try our best to solve the problem with offering a replacement or refund to you. 12-months product warranty and 24 hours friendly customer service will be offered in Kusonkey.
